sect1.title: Comparing Objects
sect1.para: When using the comparison operator (==), object variables are compared in a simple manner, namely: Two object instances are equal if they have the same attributes and values (values are compared with ==), and are instances of the same class.
When using the identity operator (===), object variables are identical if and only if they refer to the same instance of the same class.

note.para: Extensions can define own rules for their objects comparison (==).
